episodes.title: Cults and Conspiracy Theories
episodes.description:
Poulomi Saha, associate professor of English, and Tim Tangherlini, professor of Scandinavian and the Elizabeth H. and Eugene A. Shurtleff Chair in Undergraduate Education, discuss the role of conspiracy theories and cults in society, and how they have permeated our culture and piqued our curiosities. Moderated by Sara Guyer, dean of Arts and Humanities.

Introduction: Sara Guyer, Dean of the Arts & Humanities, Professor, Department of English | 0:07
Timothy Tangherlini, Professor, Department of Scandinavian and Information School | 5:35
Poulomi Saha, Associate Professor, Department of English, Director, The Program in Critical Theory | 21:54
Q&A | 40:26
Closing | 58:39

The first of the Arts & Humanities Faculty Research Series from UC Berkeley College of Letters and Science.

O17485
